newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil may raise electric rates up to 10 pct - paper.
newsitem.headline: Brazil may raise electric rates up to 10 pct - paper.

text.p: The Brazilian government may raise electricity tariffs by five to 10 percent over the next two months, the first adjustment in prices since November 1995, O Estado de S. Paulo newspaper said.
The daily quoted an unnamed Mines and Energy Ministry official as saying a differentiated hike in rates for state power distributors was "natural and inevitable."
Officials at Sao Paulo power utilities speculate that power transmission and distribution rates will be adjusted by five percent to 10 percent, the paper said.
A possible adjustment is being studied by the mines and energy and finance ministries as well as the federal government's National Department of Waters and Electrical Energy (DNAEE).
